text: Adorable coffee shop , les prix sont avec taxes ( donc pas de surprises ) et abordable, la deco est supra cute & aire de jeux pour enfant . Je recommande a 100% + Free Wifi

Service excellent, humour partout !

Le nouveau café / place pour chiller est bien installé au coin du parc Émilie Gamelin, près de l'UQAM et du métro Berri. Le concept est unique en son genre et promet d'attirer la clientèle étudiante dès septembre. Cafés, thés, gourmandises sont services dans un décor digne du parc Belmont. Il y a même un ancien wagon d'un manège, une section '' jeux de société '' , une reproduction de sous-sol des années 90 (à s'y méprendre), des cabanes pour boire ton café (oui oui) et un carrousel géant au milieu duquel il y a une banquette 360 degrés.

TOUT ÇA ? Oui madame. Vas faire un tour tu vas aimer.

Really cute spot with eclectic decor-think giraffe print and double decker study cubes. Tasty food options: panini, chili, veggie options and brunch on weekends. Coffee is more on the darker roast side, not quite 3rd wave, but my americano was still decent black. It was packed on the Saturday afternoon but I still found a table and a plug. Be warned: the bathroom is a bit tripy-strobe lights and creepy music!

By far the most interactive cafe I've been to! From umbrellas hanging from the ceiling to walls covered with floppy discs (yes you read that right) this cafe won't leave you bored..or hungry!

I got the sandwich du jour which my elementary knowledge of French told me it was the sandwich of the day. I could choose from tuna or pulled pork so I went with tuna. I believe it was about $7.50. I also ordered a fresh smoothie $4. 

Here is why this review rakes in only 4/5 stars: the food is very average. It's not bad but it's not memorable. It's a little overpriced in my opinion BUT the amazing and quirky interior makes up for it! It's a great place to go alone if you want to read a book from their mini library while sipping on a latte or to chit chat with friends under the pool floats hanging from the ceiling or even as a date night and play Mario party on their Nintendo 64.

What a cute shop!! We pass by this all the time but when they had a free coffee offer we finally went in and were blown away!

The decor is quirky and playful with little study cubby holes you can squeeze into, a piece of a roller coaster, and a Nintendo corner!

Service is friendly and quick and the place is just overall inviting and friendly.

The menu has veggie options and they're not overly pricey! As for the coffee? We only tried the espresso but it was wonderful.

I think I found my new work spot

Sympathique café, avec possibilité de manger sucré ou même salé avec des encas / plats très simples mais efficaces. Bonne ambiance pour discuter ou travailler. Il y a même un coin jeux (vidéos) pour les enfants (ou les grands enfants). Le plus: ils passent de la super musique. Bref j'ai adoré.

Très joli endroit sur la rue St Catherine....la déco vert d'eau et les petites cachettes qu'il recèle vous attireront à tous les coups!
Que vous soyez étudiant en quête de calme pour travailler, ou si vous voulez simplement flâner, c'est le bon endroit en centre ville de Montreal! 
Vous pourrez choisir parmi plusieurs boissons chaudes et encas les accompagnements de votre oisiveté! 
Je vous recommande le chocolat chaud av ses petites guimauves ou le the chai, accompagne de son mega cookie tout chaud! 
Vous m'en direz des nouvelles.....

This is honestly one of my favourite places to go to in Montreal (and I've visited quite the few places since I've moved here last year)! La Graine Brûlée checks all the ticks - it has great food and drinks, has a great vibe/atmosphere, AND it's affordable. What the heck, perfection exists y'all. 

I LOVE the layout of the store, it has a child-like element to it and it really makes it feel cozy and at-home. You get to chill with friends in boxes (which my 6-feet something friend could fit into, thankfully, he always bumps into stuff so I was worried), you get to read all the weird stuff people have left on the walls, and the ambience has been good every time I've visited.

I haven't had a lot of their foods but I've tried their vegan chili and their cookie, they were both really good! They are so vegan-friendly (aaaaand I realised I forgot to check if they're gluten-free diet friendly, so I'll do that the next time), they could also make my matcha latte with soy milk! And if you know me, any place that is vegan-friendly is a plus (I'm vegetarian but vegan food is gr8).

The drinks are average-priced, I'd say, but the food there was cheap! I got a vegan chili for $4.5 (incl. tax), which filled me up. 

I'm so happy to say that I've found a gem in Montreal, and hopefully I'm going to keep finding more

Came for the décor stayed for the latté!

Right from the start A+ for the decor.

The ambience is on point. I ordered a latté and sat in the gaming alcove to look at a guy play Mario World.

Happy with the quality of my drink I ordered a Barbie with coconut milk and a marshmallow. It was ok. Not great but different.

It's a must try because of the overall quality of both coffee and decor.

This place is just overall fun: from the hilarious name to the entertaining decor, it's a great place to be. A bit too distracting for me to study, but it's awesome if you just want to hang out with friends. The yogurt granola was delicious and not too expensive for the portion (it comes in a cute Mason jar). Their iced latte was strong and flavourful. Service is friendly and quick. And prime location in the Village.

Will definitely come back if I'm in the neighbourhood again!

1-This cafe is fun, spacious, and affordable.

2-A good place to study alone or with friends. 

3-They have great and many food options so you can go lots of times and never get bored. 

What else do I need to say to convince you? It's perfect.

I've tried their spinach dip, vegetarian chili, and hummus. 
I highly recommend their spinach dip, it is the best thing, honestly. It fills you up, tastes great, and is vegetarian. 

Grab a book/laptop/your homework and settle down here.


Tip: Get there early because seats fill up fast. Especially the booths. 
Tip 2: They have a cute lego-ish ferris wheel that spins located in the middle of the cafe. Prime Instagram material.
J'étais pressé et j'ai du most rester pour un petit déjeuner sur le pouce. Mon cappuccino étais excellent et j'ai pris le yahourt granola au poiré. Le décor est vraiment cool ;)

J'adore le pun de ce café considérant son emplacement et ils vendent de la merch avec des puns aussi drôles. Inutile de dire que je suis une fervente amatrice de puns. J'aime l'ambiance quoique un peu animée pour un café mais le style est super et hors du commun. Les toilettes sont drôles et le staff est courtois. Les breuvages sont bien mais sans plus. Définitivement un endroit à visiter si t'es jamais allé!

Wow where has this cafe been all my life? I'm really surprised I missed this gem on my cafecrawls. What a unique and fun way to have a coffee or sit and catch up with friends. I visited this cafe for a yelp book swap event and I had a great time doing a little tour before sitting down with my coffee. The decor is on point. I kept finding cute little things as I glanced around. There are cute and unique little seating areas and a study room in the back. They also had hilarious cards on display. The chai latte I had was next level. Shoutout to the super kind staff. I would highly recommend visiting this place for coffee or to study.

Endroit génial, plusieurs choix de boisson sucre ou gazeuse, gâteaux maison, et petit repas et collation délicieuse, si vous êtes amateur de Nintendo allez y vous pouvez y jouer tout en prenant un café ou autre :) 
Superbe endroit j'y retournerai
BEST.COFFEE.SHOP.EVER. ! I am from New York so i've seen my fair share of coffee shops.. but La Graine Brulée gets everything right! Hats Off !

Awesome ! Le café est grand, hyper chaleureux, coloré. On rentre et on est direct attiré par la déco festive et punchy. Une "petite roue" sur la table d'hôte tourne en continue pendant que le monde travaille sur son ordinateur tout autour. On peut se cacher dans une caisse au raz du sol pour plus de tranquillité. Les boissons sont excellentes et la nourriture l'est autant. Je commande ce café qui réchauffe le coeur.

Cute cafe with the coolest decor. I would come just for the ambience for a latte. I had a smoked meat sandwich with pickles and melted cheese which was a little expensive for the size but not bad compared to the terraces in the area (under $10). I'll definitely come back here.

Une première visite qui ne sera clairement pas la dernière. Café au décors éclectique et coloré qui sera vous charmer. J'adore les petites cabanes qui vous permette de retomber en enfance le temps d'un latte. Super service, on vous y sert avec le sourire. Un plaisir à chaque gorgée, j'y retourne très certainement.

L'endroit et le cadre sont vraiment sympas.

Je suis aller boire un chocolat chaud après le travail. Malgré le fait que je ne l'ai pas très apprécié car j'avais l'impression que c'était du lait au chocolat chauffé plutôt que du chocolat chaud, j'ai appréciée le gâteau géant au chocolat que j'ai pris. 

De plus, il est possible de boire notre verre dans des sortes de lit et il y a même une pièce dédiée au jeux vidéos avec les anciennes consoles Nintendo avec Mario, souvenirs d'enfance :-) 

Cela vaut le coup d'il

It's my "cafe away from cafe." I come to Montreal often and Le Graine has become my go-to cafe because of its work atmosphere and because it had the best espresso in town.  The cappuccino is perfection.   If you're a sugar person, you'll be surprised that you won't need much or any sugar at all because of its taste.  Also, I really like their veggie chili.

Mon dieu, tout est fantastique dans cet endroit. Le nom d'abord. Seigneur, je ne me tannerai jamais des jeux de mots louches des commerces du Village. 

C'est grand et tellement coloré! Plein d'étudiant-e-s y travaillent jour et soir. Si le café avait été ouvert quand j'habitais sur Beaudry, j'y aurais peut-être passé ma vie. 

Il y a des genre de cabanes pour les enfants (est-ce que les grands enfants y sont aussi admis? ce serait si cool!), surveillance d'un adulte nécessaire. Surveillance nécessaire aussi en jetant un coup d'il aux tasses du défunt Oui Manon (dont la classique "Réveille-toi pis fourre-moi"), qui sont maintenant en vente à la Graine Brûlée. Pour les âmes plus sage, une panoplie de livres en tous genres est disponible pour la lecture.

Scoop: semble-t-il qu'un bébé mini-putt est en construction dans le café, comme si on n'était pas assez divertis comme ça! 

Les baristas ont un sens de l'humour et de la repartie aiguisés, je leur ferais des câlins. 

Une étoile en moins pour le café qui pourrait être meilleur. Question de grains utilisés ou de talents à manier la machine, je n'en ai aucune idée. Je préfère d'autres cafés du Village question de goût dans la bouche, mais pour l'ambiance ludique, c'est à la Graine Brûlée que ça se passe!

This place is incredible - and by that I mean, amazing and genius in a way that makes you wonder why there aren't more places with a similar concept? The motif for this coffee shop is that it's like a child's play center, but for adults. It has a quirky, whimsical, and cozy feeling that makes it a great spot for lounging or getting work done. 

Minus one star because my hot chocolate was sub-par, even with the fun and cute colored marshmallows.

Ouvert à la fin de juin 2016, le décor surprend un peu. L'ameublement minimaliste et la décoration ont pour thème la fête foraine. Là grande roue, la maison hantée, les propriétaires ont fait un gros effort d'imagination pour tirer partie du grand local vestige d'une autre époque. 

Ici on sert du café, du vrai café, avec une vraie machine à café capable de produire un expresso authentique et de faire mousser le lait pour un latte ou un cappuccino. Le café s'accompagne de viennoiseries. 

Le WIFI est offert gratuitement et il y plus d'une centaine de places assises. Une petite salle d'une dizaine de places sera bientôt prête pour un groupe, un travail en équipe.

One of the best things to happen in a neighbourhood that deserves all the good things. La Graine Brûlée is a DIY labour of fun and delight and love by the same team that brought you Café Oui Mais Non up by Jarry Park. Like some magic phone booths I know, it's bigger on the inside, and once you're in, the unexpected mix of playful and studious vibes makes it so you may never want to leave. It's spacious with lots of cozy nooks for reading or meeting with groups. The bites are delicious and there are excellent healthy options. I love that I can have a glass of wine here with my coffee and my book, or while I chatter away on my laptop, this feels truly civilized.

Love love love this café, a perfect hang. My only request would be to have a nice quality filter coffee for those of us who don't dig espresso. Meanwhile, more wine for me I guess! C'est la vie. =)

This is a really cute and fun place, it has a vintage appeal. There are lots of tables, and there's a cute little nook for playing video games and being comfy! 

There are a few food choices, they're decent choices, nothing overly special. The coffee and tea lattes are great!

One criticism is the bathroom. It literally says on the door don't enter if you have epileptic. It is dark aside from a strand of christmas lights and there's a strobe light. I don't have epilepsy, but I honestly thought I may have a seizure being in there, so after the first time I used it, I dreaded having to use it. I really think they should just make the washroom normal. I have a headache and a little nausea after using it. And from my observations, people don't seem to look well when they leave the washroom.
Very nice place, the decor is really cute. The coffee is pretty good and staff are friendly. Just a tiny little problem, the bathroom lighting is not scary, but designed to induce seizures.

A super cute cafe with uniquely fun decor that makes me feel like I am in a playroom. The soups and nachos are great and they even have a drink called the Barbie latte! There are toys and play boxes everywhere, perfect for a study date or just chilling with your friends :)

Had two small coffees with my friend. Really like the deco and the set up.
This place can be packed, surprisingly.
They have very old Nintendo TV game and old tape film in one corner and a space for board games. I found a checker. We had a game, such a fun.
The coffee is good ?! I don't have a taste for coffees so don't take it from me. 
The bathroom is creepy. Some may say it is a fun to go but not for me. I got dizzy with the intense flashes. 
I really have a mixed feeling for this place. See yourself in the bathroom and let me know.

Café qui a récemment ouvert ses portes près de l'UQAM. Idéal pour les étudiants et complètement ludique. Les couleurs sont frappantes et folles. On trouve des branchements un peu partout pour les ordinateurs, des sortes de box ou on peut se mettre en retrait, cela me fait penser aux forts ou aux tentes que l'on crée lorsqu'on est jeunes. On s'isole et on peut étudier. La musique n'est pas du tout assourdissantes, on l'oublie rapidement pour se concentrer sur nos tâches. Le café propose des repas de types snacking à prix variables: 5.50$ à 9$ (hummus et carottes, grilled cheese, sandwich du jour, chili....) et les prix des cafés de 3,75 $ à 4,75$. Personnellement, je juge tout café part son chai latte, quand ton chai latte est bon tu as tout mon respect. Dans ce cas ci pour 4,75$ prix quand même assez élevé on a un large verre bien rempli, chaud et goûteux. Un mélange délicieux d'épices et parfaitement dosé. En plus, le service est agréable et l'endroit pas trop bruyant. . Petit be mol concernant la propreté, quelqu'un devrait passer plus régulièrement nettoyer table et chaises. D'ailleurs l'état des meubles laisse un peu à désirer, étrange pour un café aussi récent. Scotch tape sur les chaises qui branlent ....
The best part about this place is the little nooks and the video games. Their coffee is good too. Beautiful place to have fun with space to eat or study as well.

Great! Could go to read a book or just chill. Loved the hot chocolate  .... 
Amazing decoration!

Lovely ambiance and decoration, I didn't want to leave. Spacious, it kinda makes you feel like a kid: You can have your coffee in a bunk bed or in a table with lego-like ferris wheel !  I had the Barbie frappé (tea-based) cuz the name and colour was too hard to resist. You can get it either hot or cold, comes with marshmallows and it's delicious. They also have quirky merch like greeting cards or mugs.

Café parfait,c'est les même proprio que mon café favoris oui mais non.La deco est super mais parfois trop intense.Le latte excellent,le chai latte un peu trop sucré. Bref un café hybride ami,etude8/10

It is like a amusement park & library & eatery all in one! There are different sections inside the café that allow people to sit, lie down, lean, relax, nap, concentrate, play, read, whatever you wish! I tried their allongé and it was pretty good! The staff is also very friendly and willing to give recommendations. How the café is set up is to make everyone feel comfortable, but if you are adventurous you can explore the café inside out and discover little treasures here and there. It is just so fun here that I want to come back again and again!

"Ben voyons" ai-je dit, tout haut, avant de rire toute seule dans la cabine des toilettes tellement j'étais dépassée par l'ambiance de l'endroit. Espace ludique est un understatement! Ma visite s'est étirée sur plusieurs heures à jaser et c'était charmant. Il y a vraiment des places assises pour accomoder toutes les tailles de groupe ou tous les styles de visiteurs solo. Super bonne conscience sociale aussi, l'espace vaisselle sale, les condiments en libre-service, les manchons en laine réutilisables pour les verres chauds, ça me parle!

J'veux y retourner, pour voir qui est la crowd à différents moments. Par un samedi après-midi, y'avait pas mal juste des enfants qui trippaient dans les installations, ce qui est extrêmement cool pour les familles/fêtes/joie de vivre en général mais un TOUT p'tit peu moins pour des retrouvailles avec mon amie qui vit à l'autre bout du monde et dont les histoires étaient interrompues par des cris stridents. Chose certaine, ils se distinguent au moins des cafés troisième vague qui parfois se ressemblent tous avec leur décors épurés/blancs/bois naturel/Macbook/musique chillwave. Ce que j'aime aussi, pour des raisons différentes.

The manager at the place is an asshole! He just comes over every now and then to ask if you have spend any money, if yes you can stay but if you don't spend money as soon as you arrive then he would harass you!

La Graine Brulee is a fun, relaxed cafe that makes you feel comfortable hanging out or working on your laptop. The soy chai and the soy latte are both really good. The vegan sandwich is OK but not particularly exciting. Although the music repeated itself after a while, I really enjoyed the soul tunes and it was nice seeing the employees dancing and singing along too.

Great energetic vibe, lots of different kinds of seating - you can curl up with friends on their little green sitting platforms, or sit around the Ferris wheel or sit on their benches indoors or on the street. drinks are average but baristas are friendly. Hipster merch on sale. Bathrooms are a headachey experience though, it's dark with strobe lights.

Well.... This is a local fast food style.... the food for me its really desapointing ... but you have the decoration to enterteint your eyes while eating no tasty food. The price is too high for what it is... sorry i dont like make bad reviews but i just recomande to not expect to much about their food but if you want to see something different go to their washroom .... Its wierd.. but i guess can be funny .. see by yourself and be careful in the toilet..
